title: Hong Kong Airlines crew 'hospitalised' by Chinese tourists angry over flight delay
text:
3

Six Chinese tourists have been arrested for allegedly attacking cabin crew after their flight was delayed by more than eight hours.
According to reports coming from Hong Kong International Airport, three men and three women were arrested for physically assaulting seven crew members of their Beijing-bound flight.
After the Hong Kong Airlines flight had been delayed for more than six hours, the six passengers became angry and took out their frustrations on the ground crew at around 2.30am local time.
Passengers became livid after their Hong Kong Airlines flight was delayed by more than eight hours
Medics were called to Hong Kong Airport after seven members of staff were allegedly assaulted
Three men and four women from the airlines' ground staff were taken to North Lantau Hospital for treatment of minor injuries as a result of the altercation.
A Hong Kong Airlines spokeswoman said: 'The flight was delayed because of air traffic control in Beijing.'

'Another five tourists came forward and began pushing and shoving airline staff.'
The eventual delay was more than eight hours.
Tensions were at boiling point in the airport as passengers demanded to find out what was going on
Hong Kong police are reportedly still holding the six Chinese tourists and plan to treat the case as one of 'common assault'. They are scheduled to appear in Tsuen Wan Court today.
The flight to Beijing eventually took off at 4.45am, after a delay of more than eight-and-a-half hours.
The airline blamed the bad weather for causing such a long delay to the flight.
Queues began to build inside the terminal as people waited for news on their Beijing flight
